headline: Student at Georgia Institute of Technology
name: Joseph Cornelius

about:
I am a student majoring CS at Georgia Tech, building software solutions to solve modern problems.
I specialize in NLP and Fullstack development, and love to dive into any opportunities I can learn and grow.

experiences.title: Undergraduate Researcher
experiences.description:
∙ Analyzed NLP models such as StockNet from mid-2010s using Python and TensorFlow, evaluating if the models hold accuracy with modern data.

∙ Implemented pipelines and filtration techniques to counter intentional mixed tone of central banks of countries such as the USA, South Korea, Turkey, etc.

∙ Currently working on a new dataset format which could drastically improve classifications of hawkish/dovish stances of the Fed using pre-trained language models.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description:
∙ Developed a trilateration localization system using BLE beacons from NXP, implemented in C and packaged with CMake, achieving 9-yard accuracy for Bluetooth device positioning.

∙ Applied and trained the ECA-ResNet model using Python and TensorFlow on a RSSI localization system, improving vehicle tracking accuracy by 15% and identifying key error factors for further optimization.

∙ Implemented a customized particle filter for UWB data, reducing location measurement error by 55% within an 8 meter range, enhancing mobile digital key functionality.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description:
∙ Developed the frontend and backend of Vita-X, a cross-platform e-commerce application using ReactJS and Node.js, enabling personalized nutritional supplement recommendations based on user data.

∙ Designed and deployed a Microsoft Azure-based machine learning model to classify dietary supplements from images, extracting key product details (e.g., RDA, market data) with 97% Top-5 accuracy.

∙ Engineered a recommendation algorithm that tailors supplement suggestions based on user attributes (age, gender, dietary restrictions, current intake) using Python, enhancing user experience and safety.

experiences.title: Sergeant, Software Developer
experiences.location: Gyeryong, South Chungcheong, South Korea · On-site
experiences.description:
∙ Built a computer vision model using PyTorch to track bullet marks on targets, replacing the manual evaluation process and accelerating rifle training assessments by 75%.

∙ Launched a suite of features for 5+ military facility websites such as personnel management and room reservation using Vue and Spring Boot, improving operational efficiency.

∙ Refined and maintained databases with 500,000+ entities using MySQL and MySQL Workbench, reducing query processing time by approximately 20% and enhancing nationwide workflow efficiency.

headline: CS @ Georgia Tech
name: Soungmin Lee

about:
As a Zell Miller Scholar and dedicated Pre-Law student pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration with a concentration in Finance, I am passionate about the intersection of corporate finance and law. My academic journey is fueled by a keen interest in understanding complex financial instruments and their legal implications, with coursework that includes investments, derivative securities, and international finance.

In addition to my studies, I actively engage in leadership roles across various student organizations, where I deepen my skills in management, strategic thinking, and collaboration.

I am actively seeking internships to apply my knowledge in real-world settings and further develop my skills in finance and law. Let’s connect if you’re looking for a driven and detail-oriented candidate.

name: Nakul Kuttua
headline: Software Engineer @ Zywie Healthcare | OMSCS @ Georgia Tech
about:
As a computer scientist, I am passionate about exploring the applications of information technology, artificial intelligence, and media technology in various domains and industries.

I have gained valuable hands-on experience in IT through my internships at Newell Brands. At Newell Brands, I worked with the IT architecture and info delivery teams to support the design, development, and deployment of various IT solutions and projects. With this experiences, I have accomplished many feats using my problem-solving, free-thinking, and programming skills. I enjoy working with diverse and collaborative teams to contribute to the sustainability and innovation of our communities and environment.

Currently, I’m pursuing further education at Georgia Tech with a deeper focus on Artificial Intelligence while also interning at Zywie Healthcare as an IT Developer Intern where I build solutions to improve the quality-of-life for their main web application.

experiences.title: Software Engineer Intern
experiences.description:
At Zywie, I developed solutions to ongoing issues within the company's web server and database.
The solutions that I had developed added many quality-of-life adjustments for both the supervisor side and client side.

experiences.title: IT Info Delivery Intern
experiences.description: I worked with the Newell Brands IT Info Delivery Team to build a Data Catalog Using Microsoft Azure Purview. The project required all the data assets such as reports, spreadsheets, as well as miscellaneous files to be unified under one platform. Additionally, I was tasked to include a glossary bank of all the key terms that come from all the files into the Data Catalog so that users would be able to navigate easily and hassle-free from one file to the next.
